snippet: Germany passed a law Friday that requires some of Europe’s biggest companies to give 30 percent of supervisory seats to women beginning next year.
abstract: Germany passes law that will require German companies, some of Europe's largest, to give 30 percent of seats on corporate boards to women beginning in 2016; passage makes Germany latest to sign on to trend in Europe to legislate greater representation of women in boardrooms; unusually passionate debate preceded passage of law.

byline.original: By ALISON SMALE and CLAIRE CAIN MILLER
byline.contributor: Alison Smale reported from Berlin, and Claire Cain Miller from San Francisco.

lead_paragraph: Germany passed a law Friday that requires some of Europe’s biggest companies to give 30 percent of supervisory seats to women beginning next year.

headline.main: Germany Sets Gender Quota in Boardrooms
headline.print_headline: Germany Sets Gender Quota in Boardrooms
